documentation.text: @dev Contract to make payments. If a direct transfer fails, it will store the payment in escrow until the address decides to pull the payment.

attributes.text: @dev Contract to make payments. If a direct transfer fails, it will store the payment in escrow until the address decides to pull the payment.

devdoc.details: Contract to make payments. If a direct transfer fails, it will store the payment in escrow until the address decides to pull the payment.

payments(address).details: Returns the payments owed to an address.

withdrawPayments(address).details: Withdraw accumulated payments, forwarding all gas to the recipient. Note that _any_ account can call this function, not just the `payee`. This means that contracts unaware of the `PullPayment` protocol can still receive funds this way, by having a separate account call {withdrawPayments}. WARNING: Forwarding all gas opens the door to reentrancy vulnerabilities. Make sure you trust the recipient, or are either following the checks-effects-interactions pattern or using {ReentrancyGuard}.
